707103f-b.text:
(1)
29O01-2919 Ave. U.. north side, between East 29th Street and Nostrand Ave., show ing the home of Capt. Luts (No. 2919) in the foreground,
who was an ex-police captain.
April 1923.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
(2)
The same, showing the same house known also as Fort Lutz, Note the cannons, relics of the Civil War, which were made in 1862 and weigh
each 816 1bs.
April 1923.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
(3)
The same, at the N.W. corner of Nostrand Ave., showing the Nostrand
Ave. trolley at its terminal.
February 26, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.
707103f-b.folder: Ave. U & 29th St. E., Brooklyn, NY
